Description: An anxiety disorder characterized by recurrent unexpected panic attacks, which are sudden periods of intense fear or discomfort.
A benign growth on the vocal cords that can cause hoarseness, voice changes, and discomfort.
A chromosomal disorder affecting females, where one of the X chromosomes is missing or partially missing, leading to various developmental issues.

Thinning, drying, and inflammation of the vaginal walls due to a decrease in estrogen levels, commonly occurring after menopause.
A break in one or more of the bones in the hand, often resulting from trauma or injury.
A bacterial infection causing redness, swelling, and pain in the tissues of the mouth, potentially leading to the formation of an abscess.
Also known as strabismus, a condition where the eyes do not properly align with each other when looking at an object.
A common complication following a lumbar puncture, characterized by a headache that worsens when standing and improves when lying down.
A condition in infants causing narrowing of the pylorus, the opening from the stomach to the small intestine, leading to severe vomiting.
Conditions affecting the salivary glands, such as infections, blockages, or tumors, leading to symptoms like dry mouth, pain, and swelling.

Damage to the structures of the knee, including ligaments, cartilage, or bones, often resulting from trauma or overuse.

Mental health conditions characterized by unhealthy eating habits, such as anorexia nervosa or bulimia nervosa.

Damage to the rotator cuff muscles or tendons in the shoulder, leading to pain and decreased range of motion.
